Class RevenueRepository

java.lang.Object
com.bonus71.data.repository.RevenueRepository
public class RevenueRepository extends Object
Repository class responsible for data access operations related to Revenue entities.

Provides CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) functionality for the REVENUE database table using JDBC. Encapsulates SQL execution and result mapping, ensuring separation between persistence and business logic layers.

Database connections are managed through DatabaseConfig, and prepared statements are used to improve security and performance.

  • Method Details

    • findAll

      public List<Revenue> findAll() throws SQLException
      Retrieves all revenue records from the database.

      Executes a SELECT * FROM REVENUE query and maps each result row to a Revenue entity.

      Returns:
      a list containing all Revenue records found
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • insert

      public void insert(Revenue revenue) throws SQLException
      Inserts a new revenue record into the database.

      Persists the provided Revenue entity by executing an INSERT INTO REVENUE statement.

      Parameters:
      revenue - the Revenue entity to be inserted
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • update

      public void update(Revenue revenue) throws SQLException
      Updates an existing revenue record in the database.

      Updates the category and euro amount of a record identified by its code.

      Parameters:
      revenue - the Revenue entity containing updated data
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • delete

      public void delete(int code) throws SQLException
      Deletes a revenue record from the database.

      Removes the record identified by the specified code from the REVENUE table.

      Parameters:
      code - the unique code identifying the revenue record
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
